## GAD-7 vs GHQ-28

GAD-7 vs GHQ-28 As a psychologist or social scientist, comparing different anxiety assessment instruments like GAD-7 and GHQ-28 can be a daunting task. GAD-7 and GHQ-28 are immensely beneficial in understanding an individual's mental health condition. However, matching items from these questionnaire instruments and cross-referencing the data can be challenging as it is time-consuming and often seen as a subjective process. This is where Harmony comes in! Harmony, with massive language models and natural language processing capabilities, is an excellent tool when it comes to instrument comparison. When dealing with 'GAD-7 vs GHQ-28', Harmony can accurately compare and provide a percentage match for each item within the two questionnaires. This can prove to be significantly helpful in harmonizing your research. Plus, it supports multiple languages, broadening its global applicability. For a faster and less tedious process in managing 'GAD-7 vs GHQ-28', consider using Harmony. Whether you are working with instruments from Harmony's database or using your own in PDF format, its user-friendly web interface at https://harmonydata.ac.uk/app simplifies the process for you. Redefine the 'GAD-7 vs GHQ-28' comparison with Harmony, and focus more on what matters the most â€“ understanding and improving mental health.

## Questions in GAD-7

|   No. | GAD-7 English                                                                                                                                      |
|------:|:---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|
|     1 | Feeling nervous, anxious, or on edge                                                                                                               |
|     2 | Not being able to stop or control worrying                                                                                                         |
|     3 | Worrying too much about different things                                                                                                           |
|     4 | Trouble relaxing                                                                                                                                   |
|     5 | Being so restless that it is hard to sit still                                                                                                     |
|     6 | Becoming easily annoyed or irritable                                                                                                               |
|     7 | Feeling afraid, as if something awful might happen                                                                                                 |
|     8 | If you checked any problems, how difficult have they made it for you to do your work, take care of things at home, or get along with other people? |
